byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London, and Douglas Dalby from Dublin.
byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and DOUGLAS DALBY

abstract: Irish businessman Denis O'Brien's effort to prevent journalistic coverage of Parliamentary discussion of his relationship with Irish Bank Resolution Corporation has prompted debate about journalistic and Constitutional freedoms.
lead_paragraph: A dispute between one of Ireland’s richest businessmen and its national broadcaster has raised questions about constraints on the country’s media.

headline.main: Irish Media, Fearing Lawsuits, Steers Clear of a Billionaire
headline.print_headline: Irish Media, Fearing Lawsuits, Steers Clear of a Billionaire

snippet: A dispute between one of Ireland’s richest businessmen and its national broadcaster has raised questions about constraints on the country’s media.
